intro: Anneslia yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan anneslia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in tropical climates. Anneslia yucatanensis is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
